Judul: KAJIAN TEKNOLOGI LANDFILL MINING DALAM PENGEMBANGAN TPA (STUDI KASUS TPA LEUWIGAJAH PASCA LONGSOR)
Abstrak:
Population lifestyle and activities especially in big cities are increasing based on
time. One of the consequences is waste problems. The increasing of waste generation is
one of the waste problems that often emerge in daily life. Waste generation has a linear
relationship with total population, so the increasing of population number and activities
will result in increasing of waste generation. The increasing of waste generation
motivates people to treat the waste. Dispose waste into final disposal site (FDS) is one of
final steps in waste treatment.
Development of a FDS is done based on the quantity of waste, therefore it is related
to the service period of FDS, the area, and the cost for the FDS management. The open
dumping method of waste disposal in Indonesia is a method that can cause many
problems, it is also can cause landslide. With a short of service period, then a new area is
needed to make a new FDS. The problem is, it is difficult to find a new area. It needs big
cost to make a new FDS and may promote a conflict with the community who disagree an
FDS in their neighborhood, because of the odor, smoke, and flies disruption.
The concept of landfill mining technology is basically excavate and resources
recovery such as compost, daily cover soil, and recoverable material from closed landfill,
so the service period can be prolonged and economic potential can be calculated. In this
study, landfill mining technology is adapted for FDS in Indonesia which uses an open
dumping method and as the case study is Leuwigajah Final Disposal after landslide.
After land sliding, the waste that had covered will be opened, so it can be excavated
easily. The resources potential such as compost, daily cover soil, and recovery material
will be determined by examining the physical and chemical characteristics. The
characterization results show that there is around 52.5% potential of compost, and daily
cover soil, 33% recoverable material, and 14.5% non-recoverable material as residue
then 1,743,593 m3 of FDS can be reused.
Kata Kunci: compost, final disposal site, landfill mining, open dumping
